title: Mourning Sampler, 1839
medium:
Medium: wool embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation
provenance:
By 1981, Gertrude M. Oppenheimer
1981, Cooper-Hewitt Museum
description:
Within a black Greek key border, an inscription and verse:
When This was done this i have done to let you see what care my parents took of mee (sic)
Below, a very stylized weeping willow embroidered in black, with a bird and a dog below, and a black frame with the text: Sarah Jane Silcox Died March 24 1839, aged 13 years and six months

tombstone.epitaph:
Mourning Sampler, 1839.
1839. Medium: wool embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-142.
